moves: 1. d4 Nf6
comment: Preventing 2. e4
Putting pressure on d5.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6
comment: The Queen's Indian Defense. Black moves the bishop to b7 to put pressure on the center.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3
comment: The usual counter to the bishop on b7.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O
comment: Continuing development.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2
comment: This is a questionable move since the bishop was more powerful than the knight. The key to White's attack in this game is the power of his dark-squared bishop.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2
comment: With Black's dark-squared bishop gone, White plans to place a bishop on b2 exerting strong pressure along the diagonal.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6
comment: Black want to develop the knight on d7 rather than on c6 where it would block the bishop on b7 and the pawn on c7.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3
comment: The bishop is going to be well placed on b2.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8
comment: Black wants the bishop to be protected so that after ... Ne4 the knight will not become pinned to the bishop after White moves his queen and knight. However, this is a passive place for the rook.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4
comment: The knight is Black's best-placed piece.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3
comment: White would like to trade off the knight with 13. Nd2.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5
comment: Now Black can meet 13. Nd2 with Ndf6.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5
comment: This limits the scope of Black's bishop and increases the scope of White's queen bishop. If 13...e5 then 14. Nh4 Nec5 15. f4 threatening 16. fxe5 Nxe5 17. Nxf5. Black cannot win a piece with 15... exf4 16. Qxf4 g5 because of 17. Qd4 threatening 18. Qxg7#.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6
comment: Attacking the pawn on d5. It doesn't look like it can be defended.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4
comment: Black cannot capture the pawn on d5 safely. If 15... Bxd5 then 16. Bxf6 Qxf6 (or 16... Nxf6 17. Bxd5) 17. Rxd5. If 15... Nxd5 then 16. Rxd5 $1 Bxd5 17. Qd4 (Threatening Qxg7#.) 17... Qd7 18. Qxd5+ and Black's rook and pawn are no match for White's two bishops.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3
comment: Pinning the pawn on f5 and therefore removing its ability to protect the knight on e4. If 16... Nxd5 then 17. Qxe4 fxe4 18. Bxd7 wins. If 16... Bxd5 then 17. Rxd5 Nxd5 18. Qxe4 fxe4 19. Bxd7 and although material is even, White has a winning positional advantage.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6
comment: Black has been forced to weaken his dark squares and thus enhance the effectiveness of White's bishop on b2.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3
comment: White chases away Black's best-placed piece and prepares for an eventual e4 breaking open the position.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5
comment: Pinning the pawn on g6 and threatening to take the pawn on f5 with either the knight or the bishop. White also clears the way for moving a pawn to e4.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7
comment: Breaking the pin and bringing the queen over to help defend the king.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4
comment: Pushing back a defender of e4.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4
comment: Threatening the pawn on f5. If 20... fxe4 21. Bxd7 Qxd7 22. Bxf6 wins a piece.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4
comment: This looks like a saving move. If 21. fxe4 then 21... Qxb2. If 21. Bxg2 Nxg5 22. Bxf8 Nxh3+ 23. Kg2 Rxf8 24. Kxh3 Nf6 25. Rfe1 Nxd5 and Black has a good position with a bishop and two pawns for a rook.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1
comment: Both the Black queen and the knight on e4 are attacked.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1 Nef6
comment: The only way to save the knight and the queen.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1 Nef6 22. Bxf5
comment: If 22... gxf5 23. Nxf5 Black has only three places to move his queen, and they all lose: 23... Qf7 24. Nh6+ Kg7 25. Nxf7; 23... Qg6 24. Ne7+ Kg7 25. Nxg6; 23... Qh8 24. Nh6+ Kg7 25. Qg5#.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1 Nef6 22. Bxf5 Kh8 23. Be6
comment: White's position is overwhelming. He now threatens to advance his pawn to g4 and then to g5 attacking the pinned knight.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1 Nef6 22. Bxf5 Kh8 23. Be6 Ba6
comment: A minor distraction.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1 Nef6 22. Bxf5 Kh8 23. Be6 Ba6 24. Rfe1 Ne5
comment: Attempting to break the pin on the a1-h8 diagonal.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1 Nef6 22. Bxf5 Kh8 23. Be6 Ba6 24. Rfe1 Ne5 25. f4
comment: The diagonal will be unblocked.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1 Nef6 22. Bxf5 Kh8 23. Be6 Ba6 24. Rfe1 Ne5 25. f4 Nd3
comment: Forking the queen and rook.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1 Nef6 22. Bxf5 Kh8 23. Be6 Ba6 24. Rfe1 Ne5 25. f4 Nd3 26. Rxd3
comment: White is happy to exchange a rook for a knight in this position.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Bb4+ 4. Nbd2 b6 5. g3 Bb7 6. Bg2 O-O 7. O-O Bxd2 8. Qxd2 d6 9. b3 Nbd7 10. Bb2 Rb8 11. Rad1 Ne4 12. Qe3 f5 13. d5 exd5 14. cxd5 Ndf6 15. Nh4 Qd7 16. Bh3 g6 17. f3 Nc5 18. Qg5 Qg7 19. b4 Ncd7 20. e4 Nxe4 21. Qc1 Nef6 22. Bxf5 Kh8 23. Be6 Ba6 24. Rfe1 Ne5 25. f4 Nd3 26. Rxd3 Bxd3 27. g4
comment: Black resigned because there is no way to stop 28. g5. A possible continuation is: 28... h6 29. g5 hxg5 30. fxg5 Kh7 31. Bxf6 Rxf6 32. gxf6 Qxf6 33. Ng2 and White is up a piece.
